item.title: Litter bins are nut being emptied, 18th June
item.description:
Why are these not being emptied please? Could they be regilarly checked and emptied Thanks

item.title: Constant fly tipping, 18th June
item.description:
Morning. Is there anything that can be done about the level of fly tipping of our small close ? It's a constant problem once area is cleared we get more ??. As you come on the close in the usual spot on the right is another pile of items it was only cleared Mon. There has been an old washing machine on the pavement since last week ?? Can't you find out who registered it ? It on the main pavement of the close next to row of houses 59 to 64. There is also another fly tip at the start of close in it's usual place as you enter the close on the left. This is now a constant problem and needs investigating it was only cleared on Mon Thank you in advance. Ann
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gallon Close, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo and litter, 18th June
item.description:

item.title: 50 inch wide, 10 inch deep pothole on road by bus stop on mayplace road east, by Phoenix Football Club, 17th June
item.description:
Pothole been here for two or more months and debris is being thrown up by cars onto the bus stop and parked cars, dangerous to people waiting for a bus. The whole road is a state and dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to external wall due to grass cutters, 17th June
item.description:
Some came yesterday to cut the grass on the footpath on the side of my house. I noticed this morning there was some damage to the wall. We have just had our walls done recently so it really stood out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ightham Road, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: Dead fox on pavement, 17th June
item.description:
We have found a dead fox on our street. It has started to decompose so we have bagged it and left it for collection. The smell is terrible and it is a health hazard with kids and families going up and down the street to school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Coleraine Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned scooter, 17th June
item.description:
Boo scooter abandoned in the middle of the pavement right next to a dedicated bay for bikes and scooters. The level of selfishness and laziness of the kind of people that hire these abandoned anywhere bikes and scooters is unbelievable. Itâ€™s illustrated of why pedestrians no longer a safe anywhere pavement or Road get rid of this horrendous scheme immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Upper Ground, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
